Ask HN: What praise for a book and author made you smile/chuckle?
text:
I am in a library and was browsing books. I picked up one of the books, "Value: What Money Can't Buy" by Stephen Bayley and was reading the praise for the book and the author on the back of the book by prominent people. One of the praises, by Sir Terence Conran, in a quintessentially British way reads like this:

"He has the attention span of an acid-crazed hummingbird hawkmoth, but when he craps, it glows"

:)) I just couldn't stop laughing at this.

Ask HN: Could you share your serverless starter repository?
text:
I think that serverless can be a huge time saver and be quite inexpensive when done right.

However, I find it hard to setup in a "simple" and maintainable fashion.

There are a lot of cloud-agnostic solutions out there: Terraform, Serverless.com, Pulumi, etc... But also, for a given cloud provider, let's say AWS, you have: CDK, SAM, CloudFormation, etc...

Of course there are examples everywhere on the internet, but I feel that the HN community might have some interesting repositories to share, used to kickstart a startup, for freelancing / indie hacking or even for side projects.

Do not hesitate to also share the volume / number of users you handled with your stack, and how much it cost you.

Note 1: I tried to check if this post was a duplicate by searching for 'site:news.ycombinator.com "serverless" starter' (and other variants) and found "The ultimate SaaS template", which is kind of what I was looking for, but with more things out of the box that just serverless related stuff.

Note 2: I'm personally looking to replicate a setup that a startup I worked at was using on AWS (AppSync, API Gateway, Lambda, Cognito, DynamoDB, etc...), but they used Serverless.com and the yml files were huge and full of duplicates (not a problem per se, but there might be a better, more concise way).
